Go Wild Explorer

Discover the soul of the Himalayas, from serene valleys to majestic peaks.

Top Destinations

Journey through the most breathtaking and spiritually enriching locations in Uttarakhand.

Roop Kund
A high-altitude glacial lake in Uttarakhand, famous for the human skeletons found at its edge.

Highlights:

  • Glacial lake at ~5,000 m
  • Skeleton remains visible
  • Dramatic Himalayan terrain
Har Ki Pauri
The iconic riverside ghat in Haridwar, where the evening Ganga Aarti is a mesmerizing spectacle.

Highlights:

  • Evening Ganga Aarti
  • Major pilgrimage site
  • Kumbh Mela venue
Madhyamaheshwar
An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, part of the Panch Kedar pilgrimage circuit.

Highlights:

  • Panch Kedar temple
  • Navel-shaped Shiva lingam
  • Trek through alpine meadows
Tungnath
The highest Shiva temple in the world, offering panoramic views of the Himalayas.

Highlights:

  • World's highest Shiva shrine
  • Panoramic Himalayan views
  • Short trek from Chopta
Rudranath
One of the Panch Kedar temples where the face of Lord Shiva is worshipped.

Highlights:

  • Part of Panch Kedar
  • Sacred Shiva lingam
  • Scenic trek from Sagar or Leuti Bugyal
Kedarnath
Home to the famed Kedarnath Jyotirlinga temple, one of the most significant Hindu shrines.

Highlights:

  • Ancient Kedarnath Temple
  • Char Dham & Panch Kedar hub
  • Trek from Gaurikund (~16–17 km)
Ukhimath
Pilgrim town serving as the winter seat of deities from Kedarnath and Madhyamaheshwar.

Highlights:

  • Winter abode of deities
  • Omkareshwar Temple
  • Gateway to Chopta–Tungnath treks
Joshimath
A hill-town that serves as a base for pilgrimages to Badrinath and the Auli ski resort.

Highlights:

  • Base for Badrinath & Auli
  • Cable-car access to Auli
  • Spiritual and trekking hub
